thread.title: USD/JPY May Fall to 118 if BOJ Gives No Hint of Easing
thread.title_full: USD/JPY May Fall to 118 if BOJ Gives No Hint of Easing - WSJ

author: Hiroyuki Kachi
title: USD/JPY May Fall to 118 if BOJ Gives No Hint of Easing
text: 0101 GMT [Dow Jones] USD/JPY (now at 119.97) may become vulnerable to downside pressure, possibly falling to the 118-level again, if BOJ Gov. Haruhiko Kuroda gives no indication of future monetary easing when the central bank wraps up its two-day policy meeting Wednesday, says Nomura Securities chief FX strategist Yunosuke Ikeda in a morning note. “I assume the BOJ won’t go ahead with extra easing, as long as risk of a higher yen, or the dollar below Y117, doesn’t become imminent.” But the financial market will very likely intensify views that a delay in the Fed’s decision to raise rates will force the BOJ to...
